content.description: Sit start on the good horizontal rail. Pull on with some tricky feet and make a hard iron cross move out left to another horizontal rail. Figure out how to match, then set up and deadpoint up to a horizontal edge, then match or pull through to the lip. Once here, figure out how to mantle.P.S. Yes, it goes dab-free.
content.protection: A few pads. Maybe a blubber.
content.location: Starts on the right side of the featured wall. This problem shares the same horizontal rail for the start as for "Fiddlehead Gorge" and "Birthday Boy".

content.description: Sit start the overhanging arete on some horizontal shelf features and follow the lip/ arete up and right before rolling over on to the top of the block.
content.location: This is the well-featured arete found on the left side of the overhanging downhill face of the boulder.

content.description: This is great left to right sloping lip traverse on great rock. This aesthetic line begins matched on the sloping shelf features found on the long overhanging face. Pull onto the wall and steadily make your way to the far right of the boulder before topping out.
content.location: This line starts about 5 feet to the right of the far left side of the block.

content.description: Sit start with the right hand on a sloper seam found on the right arete and with the left hand out left on the overhanging face compressing a small hold. Pull-on and move up the arete and up to good holds at the lip before topping out.
content.location: This line is found on the far right side of the long wall. It actually has to climb slightly left to topout as for "Eating Cake".

content.description: Sit start with the left hand on a large shelf feature and the right hand on a similar shelf about a foot and a half right. Figure out the feet and pull onto the overhanging face before making a few moves up and left into the lip/ arete of "Stowed Cider". Top out with ease or by the beached whale technique.
content.location: This boulder problem is found on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start matched on a large horizontal rail on the left side of the wall. Get a good foot and move figure out a way to reach the large slot out right. There are some small intermediates to allow an awesome rose-move, or if wingspan permits, locking-off all the way is an additional method. Match the horizontal slot, and then dyno up to the lip of the boulder.This climb finishes with the same dyno as "Flying Embers".
content.protection: 2-4pads. Landing is pretty good. Dynos can spit you out though.

content.description: Sit start matched on a large horizontal rail. (This is a shared hold with Fiddlehead Gorge.)Pull on to the wall and make a hard move up to a large but surprisingly slopey slot, match, set the feet, then huck for the lip and top out.An awesome dyno problem.
content.protection: 3-4 pads. Landing is good, but it's a dyno, so the falls can be sporadic.
content.location: This problem is found on the right side of the featured face of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start matched with both hnds on the large horizontal rail in the leftside of the featured wall. Pull on and either make a hard deadpoint straight up to a crimp rail or use a bad intermediate and lock it off. Once on the rail, match or pull through to the lip to finish with a nice mantle.
content.location: Leftside if the wall. Shares the same start with "Focal Banger" and "Hard Cider". "Strainge Beast" finishes up this problem.

content.description: Sit- start matched on the shelf feature. Move up to another horizontal shelf feature before figuring out how to deadpoint up to a small slot for the left hnd or huck for the lip of the boulder. Once matched on the lip, figure out how to mantle the boulder.
content.location: This problem starts on the rightside of the downhill face of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit-start with a large undercling for one hand and the sloping shelf found on the same feature for the other. 

Find some feet and power up to the lip of the overhang. Stay tight to match and finish up the lip a few moves before topping out.
content.location: This climb is found on the right half of the long overhanging East face of the Stowed Boulder. It starts under the short overhang on an obvious blocky hold feature.Â

content.description: This line is slightly squeezed between "Fiddlehgead Gorge" and a nice birch tree root, but the movement and tension of the problem is spectacular. Sit-start on a large sidepull feature. Pull onto the wall and lock-off out right to a pocket found in the diagonal crack, from here set the feet and lock-off up to the lip before matching and executing a tricky mantle.
content.location: This is the rightmost climb found on the West facing overhanging side of the boulder.

content.description: This is a large boulder with a variety of climbs that provide a nice set of challenges. There is just about something for everyone to try on this block, such as the power endurance lip traverse "Poetically Pleasing" V?, to the powerful and precise "Fiddlehead Gorge" V3. There are still a few potential variations to be done on this boulder that might climb well.
